alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 3:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from near Summerville west to Givhans and Knightsville. As much as 1.5 inches of rain has already fallen in some areas over the past hour. As thunderstorms persist, an additional 1 to 3 inches could fall resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Ladson, Knightsville, Givhans, Sangaree, College Park, Lincolnville, Slandsville, Slands Bridge, Westoe, Dorchester Estates, Orchard Hill, Cooke Crossroads, Stallsville, Lotts Crossroads, Canaan, Centerville and Oakbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
